page.title: 11Life in Aston Village
page.content: Its peaceful in Aston, trees heavy with foliage overhange the roads and pathways. Through the branches of the willow, a duck is busily cleaning herself. Some blossom hasdrifted to the ground, leaving a hint of white here and there. In the distance I can hear the chug-chug of a tractor and the voices of the schoolchildren nearby. The pond ripples in the gentle breeze, flies hover round above. On the hill a cluster of poppies shimmer in the sunlight, and beyond, fields of brilliant yellow dip and rise. Back in the village one or two people saunter to the general stores, where a wholemeal loaf would cost about 25p. Nearby at The Rose and Crown, a couple sit outside having a drink, where a pint of beer would cost around 95p. As we leave aston, the smell of freshly cut grass lingers in the afternoor air
